ReviewList.Text: It is a shame that this nice workbook has so many errors in the solution sets. Unlike the Schaum 3000 problems this workbook can be easily used to teach yourself basic physics.  All that is needed is a basic knowledge of algebra. No calculus needed. It is not expensive to proof a book like this. You find a needy grad student and they will do it for a resonable amount. It should be assumed that even under the best of circumstances that errors will occur. However, this workbook has too many. It is a shame because the author teaches well. It is a shame to mystify a student because the wrong answer is in the solution set. Please redo this workbook.

Im not a math genius, however I am sure that many of the questions that I got 'wrong' were not incorrect. More than a few of the answers in the back of the book were wrong. Also many other typos; for example in one line it reads 2.45 cm in one inch, in the next line it reads 2.54 cm in one inch. It doesnt seem like a big deal until you are wracking your brains wondering if you did something wrong or if it was simply another typo. The content and delivery is good, but considering this is simply a workbook it probably should have been edited better.
If you are taking high school Physics this is the best book for studying for the math portion of the course!!!

As others were saying..there are LOTS of typos and errors in the answers given to the problems.  It's like somebody wrote it in an hour and published it immediately.  Also, I expected it to have a lot more problems, and more problems that were more comprehensive.  I will say, with due credit, if you work the problems diligently, it does help to give you a basic foundation to build on in an introductory physics course.  However, don't rely on your ability to work these problems to enable you to work more complex problems that you're presented with in a college level course.  Overall, the workbooks ok, but it really needs some overhauling--definetely needs proofreading and corrections made.
Good simple excersises that fill in the blanks and help start you slowly and simply into the concepts of physics.  My order took a month to arive via regular mail.

I teach Physics and our school does not have a physics text book since we do most of the course work on line. I needed a simple way to fill in the gaps for what we were getting on line and what we were doing in the classroom. The Physics for Dummies series was a great resource. The exercises were practical and easy for the students to understand. I really like the relationship between the books and the workbook. This has been really useful for my students.

The author conveniently left out some of the more challenging subjects like Archimedes Principle, converting from kg/m^3 to N/M^2 when figuring out Pressure in fluids; Density and specific gravity is only covered superficially. In general this author breezes over those more challenging questions, and only lightly covers the rest of General Physics. Save your money!

Great!  Simple problems and formulas.  Although not as advanced as a college level text, it s helpful in really understanding the basics.  I usually try to avoid certain sections of a typical physics book.  This book simply explains complex topics, and the solutions do not require scribbling two pages of logs/trig/integrals.

Strangely, I came to rely on the For Dummies Workbooks for challenging problems so I could push myself a bit. This edition is nice, but the problems are generally too easy to really keep me thinking. This is great review, however, and iterating through different applications of the equations is nice.

Bought this book for my mechanical engineering course to complement my other textbooks required for the course. It is far more simple to follow and I always find myself referring to this book over the dynamics ones recommended for the course. I would highly recommend this simple and affordable book
I received it, but the other book came first, the Wiley Pub, self-learning series on Basic Physics by Kuhn. That did the trick so I don't think I will need this book afterall.
Dummies books are awesome.  They take the most convoluted subjects and simplfy them to easily understood reading.  I am addicted to Dummies books for all subjects
The practice problems in this book apply Physics to real-life examples. This book fits well with the Physics I and Physics II for Dummies books.
The extra practice is helpful as i prepared for physics teacher exam, I use some of the work to assist with my high school physics lessons.
this book was for a family member struggling in physics.  She said it helped somewhat but not totally. Not sure  if I would recommend.
Bought this for my son who is a senior in college. He says it is a good review for class work and has helped him
For those who studied physics long time ago, this book is very good to remind and recall what is Physics.
Always worth the purchase. I have used them and now my kids have used them in college. Great to have!
This book was purchased for my son. I guess it helped, he had an F, now he has a B.

Having never taken Physics in high school or college, and having labored through Astronomy w/o this prerequisite, I decided now that I am over 70 that it was high time to learn something new.  On the first few pages of this workbook I learned so much that I never knew before about "scientific notation!"  I'm just beginning but at least I know what all the plus and minus exponents of 10 stand for.  That's great!
A very good book of physics problems with answers, very helpful.
Good Book. Very informative. Really enjoyed and learned.
This book was a very helpful source for reviewing Physics. I'd recommend to anyone taking a Physics course.
Bought this book for my Daughter going into 9th grade, looks like it will be a great help to help her learn Physics.
Excellent physics book.
Excellent !
This book would be great if I understood any physics, but unfortunately I don't have a scientific mind to grasp the concept of physics. For those who do understand physics, have at it! :-)
As the book was being sent to a prisoner, and I have not heard from him I cannot rate this article  any higher
